topics.title: Monolith to Microservices Migration: Scaling a high-impact national platform
topics.description: Scaling and optimization of a high-impact national corporate and social project within the real estate sector.

detail.title: About my experience
description: One of the most relevant projects I participated in was a national-level platform with high business and social impact within the **real estate sector**. The main objective was to transform a monolithic platform into a modern architecture based on **Microservices**, capable of scaling, maintaining, and evolving sustainably.
My role focused on the design and development of multiple **RESTful services**, utilizing design patterns, **SOLID** principles, and a **DevOps-oriented** architecture with **CI/CD**:

Tech stack used for development:
- **Node.js** with **TypeScript**
- Web server with **Express.js**
- **Websockets** and **Resumables** 
- **Jest** for unit testing
- **SonarQube** for code quality
- Repository management with **Git** and **GitLab**

Each microservice was developed under an approach of:
- Clean code.
- High cohesion and low coupling.
- Clear **documentation**.
- Automated testing.
- Continuous integration and deployment.

detail.description: Additionally, I collaborated on the development of new frontend modules using **React.js** and **TypeScript**, complementing the microservices ecosystem with modern and robust interfaces, along with the implementation of **E2E** tests with **Cypress**.

detail.title: Security and quality: vulnerability remediation in production environments
description: One of my main technical contributions was the **addressing and remediation of vulnerabilities** detected in both backend and frontend. Thanks to previous experiences, I actively participated in correcting **100% of the vulnerabilities** associated with the microservices and web modules under my responsibility.

This work included:
- Security analysis with **SonarQube** and **Fortify**.
- Refactoring of vulnerable code.
- Improvement of quality standards.
- Post-fix validation.
This approach significantly raised software quality, reduced operational risks, and guaranteed the technical viability of the project in production.

detail.title: Software Engineering in practice: processes, automation, and deployment
description:
Beyond functional development, I actively participated in the entire software lifecycle:
- Design of flowcharts and documentation of service architecture.
- Implementation of pipelines and **CI/CD** deployment.
- Creation of technical documentation for **microservices**.
- Design and execution of functional test matrices.
- Automation of unit and end-to-end tests.
This comprehensive approach allowed me not only to write code but also to contribute to the long-term stability, scalability, and maintainability of the system.

topics.title: RESTful APIs with NestJS for Entertainment and Event Mobile Applications
topics.description: Development for an international entertainment client, focused on musical events, online ticket sales, and payment processing.

detail.title: About my experience
description: In addition to microservices migration projects, I had the opportunity to collaborate with an **international client** in the entertainment sector, focused on **musical events**, **online ticketing**, and **payment processing**.

In this project, I participated as a **Backend Developer** in building **RESTful API** endpoints for consumption by a mobile application, under a modular backend architecture designed to support high concurrency and critical payment flows.

detail.title: Modular Architecture with NestJS and Payment Processing

description:
My main technical contributions included:
- Endpoint development within a modular architecture with **NestJS**.
- Optimization and refactoring of payment flows using **Stripe**.
- Implementation of background processes using **CRON Jobs** for payment status updates.
- Development of **group payment** functionalities.
- Data management with **PostgreSQL**.

Continuous deployment via:
- **Git** for version control.
- **GitLab** for repository management.
- **GitFlow** as a continuous workflow.
- **Jenkins** for CI/CD automation.
- **Nginx** as a reverse proxy and load balancer.
- **AWS EC2, EBS, S3, and ELB** for production.

Backend in **NestJS**, which allowed for:
- Modularizing the system.
- Clearly defining domain responsibilities.
- Improving scalability and maintainability.

topics.title: Backend Developer and Technical Staff for National Corporate Events
topics.description: Creation of a gradual, scalable, and robust digital ecosystem: Online ticket purchasing, Clip and PayPal payments, registration for attendees, exhibitors, sponsors, and speakers.

detail.title: About my experience
description: **Corporate Events** represented a distinct technical challenge: building systems that functioned reliably both in the cloud and on dedicated physical servers, with variable infrastructure and high concurrency.

Between **2022** and **2024**, I participated as a **Backend Developer**, **Technical Staff**, and **Operational Support** in the organization and execution of national-level corporate events within different business areas such as oil & gas, brand creation, and chambers of commerce:

Participation in various events
- Tamaulipas (2020)
- Mérida (2022)
- Puebla (2022)
- Acapulco (2023)
- Oaxaca (2023)
- Tamaulipas (2023)
- Cancún (2024)

Ecosystem Architecture
- Backend with **Node.js**, **Express.js**, and **TypeScript**.
- Modular **RESTful APIs**.
- Web **SPA** applications with **React.js**.
- Desktop applications with **Electron.js** for offline operation.
- Databases in **SQL Server**, with **batch** and differential synchronization.

My responsibility was to contribute to the development of multiple **Web Services**, **RESTful APIs**, and provide technical leadership to meet client objectives **before**, **during**, and **after** each event.
Together with the development team, we built a gradual, scalable, and robust digital ecosystem integrating: **Databases**, **Microservices**, **Web Applications**, and **Mobile Applications**.

topics.title: E-Commerce, Payment Processing, and Enterprise Synchronization
topics.description: Development of a custom E-Commerce platform for one of the most prominent national business groups, optimizing retail and wholesale operations.

detail.title: About my experience
detail.description: In **2021**, I began collaborating with one of the company's most important clients, a national organization in the grocery commercial sector with retail and wholesale sales. This project marked a key stage in my consolidation as a backend developer specializing in **e-commerce** and **payment processing**.

detail.title: Retail E-Commerce
detail.description: My first **E-Commerce** project was the complete custom development of an online grocery store for retail sales. This project involved transforming a 100% physical operation into a hybrid **physical-digital** one, where one of the most significant challenges was integration with the client's **ERP** and points of sale across **6 national Distribution Centers (CEDIS)**.

description:
Which required:
- Synchronization with the client's internal systems.
- Design of purchase flows, validation, and stock control.
- Online sales process with **cash on delivery**.
- Sending purchase notifications to each **CEDIS** and customers.
- Coordination with the client's technical and operational teams.

detail.title: Wholesale E-Commerce
detail.description: Subsequently, we developed a second independent **e-commerce** for one of the client's most important business lines: **wholesale sales**. Although it shared certain components with the **retail system**, this project required specific features:

Added value:
- Distinct business logic for sales closures.
- **Online payment processing**.
- Integration of **BBVA** and **Banorte** payment gateways.
- **Certification** and **audits** by the banks.
- Stability and performance validation.
- Safe retry handling and failure recovery.

detail.title: Automation and Bulk Data Loading
description: To keep information synchronized in real-time between the client's **ERP** and the **E-Commerce** platforms, I designed and implemented automated bulk data loading processes. One of the most relevant technical challenges was synchronizing large volumes of data between both systems under time and availability constraints.
Since the **ERP** had limitations exposing real-time data, we designed optimized batch processes capable of processing more than **80,000 records** in less than 30 seconds, periodically and securely.

**Batch** processes implemented with:
- **Node.js** with **Express.js**
- **JavaScript** and **TypeScript**
- **SQL Server** with **MSSQL Bulk**
- Background **Cron Jobs**
- Use of **encryption algorithms** to protect sensitive information.
- Design of data pipelines with **validation**, **transformation**, and **persistence**.

Technical results:
- **Auto-scaled batch** process
- Processing of **+80,000 records** in less than 30 seconds.
- High availability.
- Data integrity.
- Resilience against partial failures.

detail.description: This allowed the **e-commerce** platforms to reflect updated information without affecting system performance or stability.

detail.title: Vulnerability Management with Tenable
description: As part of the e-commerce systems' maturation, security analysis tools like **Tenable** were integrated to identify system vulnerabilities.

My responsibility was to:

- Analyze vulnerability reports.
- Prioritize risks.
- Implement solutions at the **Backend** and **Frontend** levels.
- Validate fixes.
Through this process, **up to 90% of detected vulnerabilities** were resolved, significantly strengthening the security posture of the developed platforms.

detail.description: This project marked a turning point for the company, allowing it to evolve from a limited digital radio station into a **modern multimedia platform**.

Create advertising campaigns through:

Project presentation.

- **Hybrid integration** between their digital station and streaming transmission.
- **Operational adoption** of the new platform.

detail.title: My Professional Contribution

- **Translator** between business and technology.

topics.title: Process Automation and Electronic Invoicing
topics.description: Construction of a national platform for the oil and gas sector, automating critical processes and implementing an electronic invoicing solution.

detail.title: Design of critical regulated services
detail.description: In 2020, I assumed technical responsibility for a national project for the **oil and gas sector**, whose objective was to digitalize and automate administrative, accounting, and operational processes that until then were performed manually or semi-automatically.

The system was designed around four main modules:

1. **Purchase Order Generation Module**
2. **Administrative Management Module**
3. **Accounting Module**
4. **Operations Module**

In addition to participating in development, I assumed a **technical leadership** role, coordinating the team and following up on functional requirements. My responsibilities included:

- Requirements gathering and analysis.
- Design of **UML** and **ERD** diagrams.
- System architecture planning.
- Development supervision and quality control.

detail.title: Electronic invoicing as the main challenge
detail.description:
My primary technical contribution focused on the administrative and accounting modules, specifically the implementation of the electronic invoicing service. This was one of the project's biggest challenges, as it involved:

- Deep research into **SAT** (tax authority) fiscal processes.
- Analysis of Authorized Certification Providers (**PAC**).
- Selection of the most suitable provider based on cost, availability, support, and scalability.
- Complete documentation of fiscal and technical processes.
- Invoicing service implementation using: (**Node.js**, **JavaScript**, **TS**, **Express**, **SQL Server**, **Azure**)

detail.title: Frontend Development
detail.description: As a Fullstack Developer, I also actively participated in the development of several frontend submodules using **React.js** and **Redux**, implementing **SPA** interfaces oriented toward user experience with clear and consistent flows.

detail.title: Focus on real-world operation
description:
Given the client's high level of operational complexity, the system was developed in parallel with their existing infrastructure. This involved:
- Working closely with the client.
- Continuous validation of each requirement.
- Planning migration strategies.
- Controlled execution of production deployments.
The result was a system that not only automated critical processes but also allowed the client to operate more efficiently, securely, and with full traceability.

topics.title: Migration from ASP Classic (Legacy) to Node.js
topics.description: Together with a development team, I led the modernization of Prointernet's critical infrastructure to replace obsolete ASP Classic systems.

detail.title: Critical and Emerging Backend Shift
description: My first major responsibility at **Prointernet** arose from a critical company need: its backend infrastructure based on **ASP Classic** suffered from severe obsolescence, security, and scalability issues. These risks threatened the stability of existing services and the company's ability to develop new digital products.

To address this situation, a dedicated team was formed, of which I was a part, with the mission of designing a technological modernization strategy. We created a testing lab where we researched, evaluated, and compared different backend ecosystems:

Activities performed:

- Comparative analysis of frameworks and architectures. - Development of functional prototypes. - Performance, security, and scalability testing. - Evaluation of infrastructure and maintenance costs. - Compatibility with **RESTful** and **Event-Driven** architectures.

Frameworks analyzed and proposed:

- **Laravel (PHP)** for monolithic MVC. - **Spring Boot (Java)** for robust enterprise architectures. - **.NET** for corporate environments. - **Node.js** for microservices and APIs focused on events and asynchrony.

detail.description: As a result of these tests and considering the company's business model, it was decided to adopt **Node.js** as the primary backend. From there, we initiated a progressive process of migrating legacy **ASP Classic** systems to **Node.js**, always maintaining active operation without affecting end users.

description: Between 2019 and 2022, I worked directly on the migration and development of projects related to:

- **E-Commerce** platforms.
- Corporate **Landing pages**.
- **CMS** systems.
- Administrative management systems.
- **Web applications** for psychometric evaluations.
- Specialized software for the oil and gas sector.

This process involved not just rewriting code but redesigning architectures, improving data models, optimizing business flows, and establishing new development practices. Concurrently, the company underwent significant organizational changes. We evolved alongside the company by implementing:

- New development processes.
- Best practices in operational management.
- Agile methodologies such as **Scrum**.
- Onboarding of new technical team members.
- Exposure of **RESTful APIs** to decouple frontend and backend.
- Rewriting critical modules prioritizing business impact and technical risk.
This stage laid the technical and cultural foundations that allowed for scaling more complex projects in the following years.
